item.title: Notes on PacBSD
item.description: PacBSD is a FreeBSD kernel/world with a PacMan Arch package manager and an optionnal OpenRC init system. In short ZFS, DTrace and the FreeBSD kernel but the simplicity of Arch for packages management but the Gentoo init. It’s experimental, uncompleted, unfinished, lacks proper documentations but it works and could be/should be the solution we are waiting for :). Here is some notes on installation (in QEMU), note that it slightly diverges from the official install since it’s using a whole ZFS disk, so no GPT.
